data.title: no go
data.text: Took the family there to go up the tower.  Checked on line for the hours, noon to 4 Sunday.  Got there at 3:15 at the desk they said you can only by tickets online.  They don't sell them there.  I asked if I could buy them on my phone.  They said they stop selling after 3PM.  Big waste of time.

data.title: Nice traditional 'scraper
data.text: Differing to all the usual blocky glass towers springing up it's nice to see something prominent in a truly traditional style. The mall below is nice and open and you can also catch the train from under there too.

data.title: Taking elevator to view
data.text: The self guided tour up elevator to scenic view is well worth the view of Cleveland. I highly recommend.

data.title: Transit Hub, Used to be Very Grand
data.text: One can catch a Rapid Transit train here to the airport or out to the East Side.  This used to be Cleveland's grand old train station, and some of the stunning architecture remains.  Sadly it's under-utilized and there are lots of empty spaces with few people around.  Big feature is a food court, which is nothing special.

data.title: The best view of downtown from the observatory
data.text:
From April to November you can go to the observation deck to get the view of downtown. It costs $6 per person , Quite affordable It is open only from 9 to 5 on weekends.
The view of the terminal tower is best from Edgewater Park or Heritage Park (Flats)

data.title: Great piece of architecture inside and out.
data.text: Beautiful building with ornate staircase and fountains. Lots of dining, shopping and entertainment options inside as well

data.title: Cleveland Landmark
data.text: I love the Terminal Tower. I can see it almost everyday in my travels around town, and it's a sign that I'm home. The changing colors at night are terrific and support a variety of things - our sports teams, charity events, it even went purple after the death of Prince

data.title: Very Cool Architecture on the outside
data.text: Inside it is basically a mall. Many stores were empty. There is a rail hub downstairs. There are several eateries inside.

data.title: A must see day and night!
data.text: Great place to check out! Surrounding area is great to hang out and relax. A must see during the day and at night.

data.title: A Must See
data.text: Take you camera as this place is awesome with lots of photo op. Sorry i don't have one to post at the moment but it is a must see. It's free with lots of other cool places to check out nearby.

data.title: Worth Seeing
data.text: When in Cleveland, Ohio, a visit to the Tower City Center is worth the time,  This is an impressive piece of architecture that contains a number of shops, a casino, hotels, and is the main hub of Cleveland’s rapid transit system.  During our time in Cleveland, one night the tower was lighted in pink lights to bring awareness to breast cancer research.

data.title: a view from the top
data.text: we were pleasantly surprised that the observation deck was open to the public as it has been closed for years  haven't been up there since I was a kid  the views of Cleveland are outstanding

data.title: Nice building
data.text: The subway stops here and it was the focal point or transfer hub to Progressive Field and Quicken Stadium. Lots of shops and stores downstairs and the building lights up at night and looks really cool.

data.title: Good
data.text: Nice view of the city. A lot of history. The people was nice. A lot of people visiting out of town. Great

data.title: Outstanding view
data.text:
Every large city that has a tower of this height should be your 1st stop to get a perspective of the town and its history.Cleveland's Terminal Tower does just that with views of Lake Erie,the University area,the West side etc..
There is no ticket counter we found out and were told reservations had to be made on line and they were $5. You take the elevator to the 32nd floor and switch to another that takes you to the 42nd floor observation room where you get a beautiful panoramic view from this classic 1929 structure.
The Terminal Tower is located in the center of town by the public square and we were able to find free parking just 3 blocks away on a Saturday morning.

data.title: What a view!!
data.text: On a clear day you really can see forever!  The elevator ride to the observation deck is quick, and once at the top, the directional signs and historic pictures help you know lots more about Cleveland.

data.title: Neat Place Very Busy
data.text: Center of Cleveland. Shopping and food vendors everywhere. Plus restaurants surrounding. Was with my grandchild and he enjoyed the bustle and sights. Underneath is the rail system that brought us from the airport. My grandson had that wow expression on his face the whole day.

data.title: Awesome Views
data.text: The 365 degree view of the city from the observation deck was awesome!  I loved the little facts that were on the walls

data.title: Best viewpoint of the city and lake
data.text: The terminal tower is a Cleveland landmark. The observation deck is open on weekends in the summer season and while small offers some great views in all directions. It is inexpensive to visit. The lobby of the tower is also worth a look for its artwork. Deeper into the tower complex is a shopping mall, food court, movie theatre, and a casino.

data.title: Classic architecture right out of Gotham City
data.text: Great views from the top and accessible to many Cleveland attractions. easy access to the mall area and the Marriott Renaissance Hotel.
